class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        # Sort both cuts in descending order
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)

        h_segments = 1  
        v_segments = 1  
        total_cost = 0

        i, j = 0, 0

        while i < len(horizontalCut) and j < len(verticalCut):
            if horizontalCut[i] > verticalCut[j]:
                total_cost += horizontalCut[i] * v_segments
                h_segments += 1
                i += 1
            else:
                total_cost += verticalCut[j] * h_segments
                v_segments += 1
                j += 1

        # If there are remaining horizontal cuts
        while i < len(horizontalCut):
            total_cost += horizontalCut[i] * v_segments
            i += 1

        # If there are remaining vertical cuts
        while j < len(verticalCut):
            total_cost += verticalCut[j] * h_segments
            j += 1

        return total_cost
